definition: Public Safety Answering Point. A facility equipped and staffed to receive 9-1-1 calls.
Computer Aided Dispatch. Systems used by dispatchers to track status and location of resources.
Service Level Agreement. A commitment between a service provider and a client.
Teletypewriter / Telecommunications Device for the Deaf.
Emergency calls received on a standard 10-digit phone line rather than the 9-1-1 network.
